name: Introduction to Mechanics
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to classical mechanics. Topics include vector kinematics and dynamics, work and energy, conservation of energy, momentum, collisions, rotational kinematics and dynamics, torque, angular momentum, oscillations, and waves.

name: Introduction to Electromagnetism
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to classical electromagnetism. Topics include electric fields, Gauss's law, electric potential, capacitance, current and resistance, magnetic fields, Ampere's law, Faraday's law, inductance, AC circuits, and Maxwell's equations.

name: Mathematics for Physicists
description: This course provides the mathematical foundation for the study of physics. Topics include linear algebra, differential equations, vector calculus, complex analysis, and Fourier analysis.

name: Mechanics II: Lagrangian and Hamiltonian Mechanics
description: This course covers advanced topics in classical mechanics, including Lagrangian mechanics, Hamiltonian mechanics, variational principles, small oscillations, and classical chaos.

name: Electromagnetism II: Electromagnetic Waves and Optics
description: This course covers advanced topics in classical electromagnetism, including electromagnetic waves, polarization, interference, diffraction, dispersion, and special relativity.

name: Quantum Mechanics
description: This course provides an introduction to quantum mechanics. Topics include wave-particle duality, the Schr√∂dinger equation, quantum states and operators, wave functions, the hydrogen atom, angular momentum, and the harmonic oscillator.
prerequisites: Mechanics II: Lagrangian and Hamiltonian Mechanics

name: Thermodynamics and Statistical Mechanics
description: This course covers thermodynamics and statistical mechanics. Topics include laws of thermodynamics, applications of thermodynamics, kinetic theory of gases, partition functions, ensembles, and the statistical mechanics of simple systems.

name: Classical Mechanics III: Special Topics
description: This course covers advanced topics in classical mechanics, including rigid body dynamics, celestial mechanics, and continuum mechanics.
prerequisites: Mechanics II: Lagrangian and Hamiltonian Mechanics

name: Electromagnetism III: Special Topics
description: This course covers advanced topics in classical electromagnetism, including relativistic electrodynamics, electromagnetic radiation, and electromagnetic potentials.
prerequisites: Electromagnetism II: Electromagnetic Waves and Optics

name: Quantum Mechanics II: Special Topics
description: This course covers advanced topics in quantum mechanics, including the hydrogen atom, perturbation theory, scattering theory, and quantum field theory.

name: Astrophysics
description: This course is an introduction to astrophysics. Topics include the properties of stars, the interstellar medium, the Milky Way galaxy, galactic structure and evolution, and cosmology.
prerequisites: Mechanics II: Lagrangian and Hamiltonian Mechanics
Electromagnetism II: Electromagnetic Waves and Optics
